name: Heritage Hotel Hallstatt

reviews.text: Most expensive but also best hotel in hallstadt (145 € incl. breakfast isnt. too much for such a location and quality hotel)
reviews.title: Super Location, Lake & Mountain view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: directly located at the famous lake
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable hotel with amazing views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel has 3 houses in this old city - we stayed in a stone house aprox.800 years old, with phantastic lake and mountian view and excellent rooms.
reviews.title: Great location, poor service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the corner room above reception. The only problem we had with the room was the church bells going off early in the morning next door. They were loud but forgivable at the same time.
reviews.title: What fantastic views

reviews.text: We had an amazing view of the lake. One of the most beautiful lakes I've ever seen. The room was quite large and very clean. The bed was comfortable although it was two twin beds put together, typical European style. Nice big bathroom, separate toilet room. Nespresso machine. Buffet breakfast was OK, nothing special.
reviews.title: Fawlty Towers in Austria

reviews.text: It's hard to get lost looking for the Heritage Hallstatt, because it's right across the car park from the ferry landing. Hallstatt is like a magical fairy land, with the most spectacular views imaginable, and I was lucky to have a room at the Heritage with its own little private terrace, where I could sit with a book and a glass of wine and take in the beauty of the lake and mountains. I had the handicapped suite on the first floor, so the bath was huge. The bad side of this is that the room was right by the bar, and there was some laughing and singing into the late hours that kept me awake. A minor inconvenience compared to the great view. Try the potato soup with truffles and the amazing topfenstrudel at the restaurant!
reviews.title: All About the Views

reviews.text: This hotel was a total splurge for us. We stayed at the Heritage Hotel in Hallstatt for three nights earlier this month, in a Junior Suite on the 5th floor (really the 3rd floor... but that's another story). We had a lovely view of the lake. The hotel was pristine. The people remarkably friendly. Breakfast was included and was a really nice spread. We were there for three nights, but I really wish we'd stayed a night or two more. Hallstatt itself is a pretty little town with incredible history, and there is a lot to do around there, even with our nearly-4 year old daughter. We went on the Salt Mine tour and also an ice cave tour, and spent a lot of time just wandering around the little village. There's not much there, which is just perfect. The hotel was a refuge and the weather beautiful, so we opened up the doors and windows to our balcony and just enjoyed.
reviews.title: I wish I stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only down-side was the church bells that rang each morning at 6am. The hotel is located right between the two churches, so it's about 90-seconds of ringing.
reviews.title: Great location right on the lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took a little video tour of our room, that you can find here: http://youtu.be/0rAkeUSqz4A
reviews.title: Great location, but find an alternative hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two days in May. Hallstatt itself is definitely worth visiting and early May seems like a great time to visit, not many tourists but lovely weather.
reviews.title: PERFECT HOTEL

reviews.text: We had booked only one night in Hallstatt, arriving around lunch time from Venice and leaving the following afternoon to Salzburg. It was summer, sunny and warm and could not have been more beautiful.
reviews.title: magical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The parking outside town was easy to find and the shuttle bus to the hotel also easy.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location and one amazing view!

reviews.text: I wish I could remember the name of the lady on reception as she was so welcoming and friendly, and went above and beyond check in duties. She gave us a map of the area highlighting things we should not miss on our short stay. She also gave us recommendations for Salzburg the following night and then even called a restaurant in Salzburg to make a reservation for us so that we would not miss out!
reviews.title: First Class All the Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was so perfect. The room clean and large with nice amenities including nespresso machine. Beds were comfortable and modern bathroom. A balcony to look over the lake and town. The restaurant downstairs also lovely with nice staff who looked after us and I don't remember it being too expensive. The only thing that was wrong (and was not the fault of the hotel) was the town bell that rings at 0600! My friend and I still laugh about how I jumped out of bed in a panic yelling "what's happening!" when the bells were ringing! haha
reviews.title: Dissapointing for the price, especially the BED is terrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I want to go back in the winter and would not even consider staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Picture perfect location, very good hotel

reviews.text: The hotel had a nice view and decent beds, but that was about it.
reviews.title: Great view, not great review
Modern hotel with great restaurant
reviews.text: The receptionist was very rude and misled us with everything, including telling us there was free parking (which we paid 9 euros for). She did not tell us how to get back to the hotel; it turns out there were gates blocking the way in which you had to pay for or insert a card! She most likely assumed we would pay a taxi to get back in. She was rude to us throughout our stay. There are also no channels in English on their TV - she said they got CNN "sometimes" (probably once, in 2006.) After trying to speak about this with a manager we were told the manager had been absent for the 2 days during our stay - and it turned out the rude receptionist was filling in as manager. After talking to her about our concerns she yesed us to death and essentially tried to send us away (this was during check out).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were also very dirty. They were very dusty and unpleasant to stay in. There were also bugs all over the place. We had 2 rooms on different floors; on the stairs connecting them there were probably 4 dead bees and 2 dead flies (keep in mind there were about 5 stairs). When our little kid went to go take a shower, there was a large spider we were forced to crush with a towel on the ground, and another one on the ceiling above the shower. There was also a spider on the ceiling above our bed and one on our bed.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very poor and definitely not worth what we paid. The quality was so amazingly bad, I don't know what people were raving about in the other reviews. We also did not know where to go for dinner on the night we were there, so we decided to eat at their restaurant. Paying a lot of money for 2 bowls of pasta and 3 weinerschnitzels (none of which were any good (or edible)) we were very upset. We decided to store it in the fridge to eat the next day, and in the end the fridge did not work. We were forced to throw it away.
reviews.title: excellent hotel in fantastic town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, I would not recommend this hotel at all. Horrible quality and service, with pricy rooms that are definitely not worth the stay.
reviews.title: Lacking soul

description: The building work began on the historic hotel project punctually on the 3rd of February just as it started to snow again. During the first stage of the building project the three Hotels (Haus Kainz, Haus Seethaler, Haus Stocker) were renovated and expanded to luxury in historic traditional style. After partial opening in the summer the first building phase will be finished in autumn 2009 and completely opened from October. The hotel complex will be run by the Azalea Hotel Management GmbH.The houses are very closely connected to the history of Hallstatt and its World Heritage site.
